channel.title: Lightning strikes the Vatican hours after pope resigns
channel.description:
doodeedoodeedoodeedoodee
[url=http://www.weather.com/news/pope-resigns-20130211]http://www.weather.com/news/pope-resigns-20130211[/url] http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2276884/Pope-Benedict-XVI-resigns-First-Pontiff-600-years-stand-longer-strength-carry-on.html#axzz2KeLLrvGO
[img]http://i.imwx.com/common/articles/images/vatican-strike_650x366.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2013/02/11/article-2276884-17841A9A000005DC-22_634x815.jpg[/img]
just a lone storm passing though [img]http://i.imwx.com/common/articles/images/vatican-radar_366h.jpg[/img]
inb4 religion and coincidence (which it probably was)

item.title: Lightning strikes the Vatican hours after pope resigns
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

ruler omar[quote=“Ruby, post:38, topic:483282”][quote author=vortex link=topic=601516.msg4222480#msg4222480 date=1360841136]

[quote author=Ruby link=topic=601516.msg4220131#msg4220131 date=1360690294]

[quote author=vortex link=topic=601516.msg4219825#msg4219825 date=1360678282]

Were did you find this image? I don’t think its legit :S

I’m sorry was weather.com not a legit source of weather news?
[/quote]No. It’s owned by a company in the US and is obviously used as a channel by your government to spread propaganda.

I didn’t know that bowser had two accounts on this forum.

[/quote]Are you me? I didn’t know ruler had made a new account either
[/quote]Too much of a newfag to know ruler.[/quote]Then I guess we’re even as I’ve no idea who that bowser guy is (assuming we’re not talking about the Mario villain)

Read full topic

item.source: Lightning strikes the Vatican hours after pope resigns

item.title: Lightning strikes the Vatican hours after pope resigns
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:33, topic:483282”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=601516.msg4220739#msg4220739 date=1360729414]

Wouldn’t of expected the cctv cameras to be such good quality but apparently they record up to 11mpx. My case is closed, already.

It’s not like a regular video camera couldn’t catch lightning but yeah, the odds of someone video taping/slow-mo camming the Vatican on the day the Pope announces his resignation is really slim (but it’s not like it couldn’t have happened).
[/quote]

[quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=601516.msg4220694#msg4220694 date=1360728218]
Weather.com: I think I’ll take a photo ofrecord this church here and hope something amazing happens.
Weather.com: Okay say cheese!
Lightning: Pew
Weather.com: Wasn’t photoshoped at all…
[/quote][/quote]

I saw on a report on TV that someone waited in the storm for two hours recording the Vatican expecting it to happen.

Also, it’s been reported that some sort of lightning rod was put there during renovation. I can’t remember all the details, I was trying to go to bed and my roommate left the tv on.

Read full topic
item.source: Lightning strikes the Vatican hours after pope resigns

I doubt it was photoshopped

but they could have charged the cross to attract lightning during the storm and took a picture expecting it to happen

item.title: Lightning strikes the Vatican hours after pope resigns
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Krackkid:

Buildings get hit by lightning all the time big deal, now if the pope him self got hit by the lightning I would get worried o.o

Put into this perspective, I guess you’re right lol. My house got struck a few years back and the AC blew. That sucked >.>

Read full topic
